inn1.comm: down the leg side, called wide, so England up and running straight away
adjusts his line, onto middle and off, Roy is solidly forward and defends to the leg side
hint of width outside off, ball comes on nicely to the bat, cut firmly square into the covers
on the pads, timed nicely with a flick but picks out square leg
can't find the gap again on the off side as he cuts off the front foot
dabbed down to third man to get off the mark
full toss, hint of swing into Hales, clipped firmly to midwicket
a sweet flick from Roy, full and straight, plenty of bottom hand but again he picks out a fielder at midwicket although he can't quite stop it cleanly
full outside off, shaping in, defended
tight run! Hales works a straight delivery into midwicket, they set off straight away but Rizwan is very quick and a direct hit at the non-striker's end would have been out
shoved way down the leg side, a tumbling take from Sarfraz
back outside off, he's on the front foot, drives it hard into the ground and it bounces to point...not finding the gaps early on
tight outside off, blocked firmly back down the pitch
some gentle swing into Roy on a full length and he clips to deep square leg
short of a length, Roy on his toes and tucks it off his hip behind square on the leg side
round the wicket, angling in, Roy defends and the ball runs off a thick inside edge
back of a length outside off, driven square from the back foot behind point
pushed firmly into the leg side, space at midwicket
left alone outside off
appeal for lbw as Hales falls across the line playing to the leg side, but from round the wicket and where Irfan bowls from on the crease the angle is significant and it is heading down leg
fortune for Roy! He comes forward and drives at a full delivery, takes an inside edge past the stumps and down to fine leg
on a length outside off, Roy is forward and defends
drives at another full ball, the bat twists in his hand and squirts into the leg side
opens the face as he walks into the shot to a ball outside off, backward point dives to make the save
played back from where it came with a perfectly straight bat this time
fuller outside off, a punchy drives finds mid-off
on the pads, Hales doesn't make contact and it deflects into the leg side
dabbed away from around off stump to third man
on the legs again, flicked away behind square and Wahab runs around from leg leg
round the wicket, full outside off, 79mph, guided to third man
short outside off, Roy fetches it from quite wide with a flat-bat pull which goes through midwicket but he hasn't got his timing yet
now, he's timed that much better, pushes forward into a length ball and sends it straight of mid-on
more runs to third man as Hales plays this with an open face
superb fielding by Shehzad at point as Roy drives powerful on the up square of the wicket
uses his feet, comes down the pitch outside off, plays a short-arm pull but picks out midwicket where there is another fumble from Rizwan who then blames the light/shadows
driven off the back foot to cover
driven to backward point
full on the pads and Hales slots this away wide of short fine leg with a well-timed flick
back of a length at off stump, angled down to third man...Roy has the face of someone battling a little at the moment
punched off the back foot to cover
cut away behind square but third man is able to keep them to a single
another edge! This one even closer to off stump. Roy aiming to drive through the off side, the ball skims past the timber off the bottom edge and beats the keeper
full at middle and off, 89mph, a thud of a defensive shot to cover
swing and a miss outside off as Roy as a dart at a full delivery going across him
back of a length at off stump, played back to the bowler
whips a straight delivery through the leg side to deep square
full at off stump, a slightly slower ball at 73mph, driven back down the pitch...it was an offcutter
uses his bottom hand and takes this from outside off towards mid-on
a poor delivery, low full toss on the pads, easily flicked away behind square
full and straight, another strong flick but this time he picks out midwicket
full outside off, a good stride forward and he drives to cover
pulls the length back, just outside off, played down to third man
moves right across the crease, it's a back-of-a-length delivery which he dabs to the off side
parried away by slip as he dives to his right to try and cut off Hales late cut
tucked off the stumps out to deep square
a strong square drive at a wide delivery but backward point is in the way
good delivery, squares up Roy and brings an lbw shout as he plays right across the line but was high and probably pitched outside leg
much tighter this time, defended to the off side
forward and drives to cover
gets this over the infield, gets underneath a full ball and deliberately goes in the air over cover but it doesn't skip away over a lush outfield
cut wide of backward point, good placement by Hales as it's also wide of third man...brings up the fifty stand, a solid base for England
guided down to third man again, straight to him on this occasion
full outside off, 89mph, Hales crabs forward and pushes to cover
back of a length, late cut but can't beat backward point
full outside off, a sweetly timed drive through the off side but there's a sweeper back on the cover fence now
opens the face to a back-of-a-length delivery on off stump and finds backward point
cuts off the front foot through point, the sweeper gets around
third man has been a popular route today and this is another single down there

terrific catch! Irfan breaks through. Hales going for a pull to a shortish delivery, comes off the toe of the bat as he tries to fetch it from outside off and the ball flies down to third man where Malik makes an excellent running catch to his left
onto the front foot and drives, in the air for a while, but bisects gully and backward point
angled in from round the wicket, Roy takes his bottom hand off the bat as he defends
a late dab down to third man
short of a length outside off, Root onto his toes first ball and plays to backward point
lovely delivery! Round the wicket, angles in, then nips away off the seam to beat Root's edge by some distance...Irfan has been so impressive this series
back of a length outside off, 88mph, driven without much timing to mid-off
on the stumps, defended to the off side
tries to force this full delivery into the off side but can only push it back to the bowler
that's a cracker! His best of the day by far. A full delivery, on the stumps, and Roy drills straight through the line with a perfectly straight bat down the ground. Lovely.
drags the length back a touch, worked into midwicket
onto the back foot, defended to mid-off
staying round the wicket, short outside off, cut to point
nearly chips to mid-on...a full ball, slower at 74mph, Roy is early on his drive but the ball lands a few metres short
finds point again
delicate this time, short of a length, Roy waits a fraction longer and flicks it down to third man through where slip would have been
sweetly played, a strong pull from Root which whistles through square leg but Babar Azam makes a full-length diving save at deep square

very neatly played, oh that's super, he walks forward to a full delivery which is angling into the stumps, uses the angled and flicks it effortlessly through straight midwicket...Azam can't do anything about this one
short of a length outside off, driven to deep cover
full and straight, punched to mid-on
walks forward into a defensive shot and plays to cover
full outside off, driven to left of mid-off
back of a length on off stump, opens the face, dabbed down to third man
another sweet piece of timing into the leg side but Rizwan dives across from midwicket
full and straight, played back to Yasir
driven into the leg side and can't beat midwicket
shorter, he goes back and pushes into the off side but can't find a gap
hint of slow spin, touch short again, but another dot ball into the off side
square cuts this behind point, backward point dives and parries the ball wide of short third man who was coming across behind him...but just one run
full and straight, played back to the bowler
full and straight and pushed back down the pitch
on the pads, whipped tidily into the leg side and a quick call for the single
solidly forward and pushed into the covers
cut firmly but straight to backward point
full and straight, an easy-tempoed steer into the leg-side, presenting a very full face down the wicket
ferocious straight drive and Anwar must regret making such a spirited effort to grab it in his followthrough. That rattled his fingers hard
driven along the ground
open face, eased to wide mid-on
stepping back and across, a firm slap into the covers
driven on the up, into the covers again
pierces the gap again
compact drive, into the gap in the covers, a well milked over
stands tall in the crease and pushed to mid-on, who fields with a dive
chopped into the covers again
steered to mid-on
a hint of width, filleted down to third man
nicely deflected down to third man, a very late late cut, and that is his half-century, his second of the series
clipped to leg
massive appeal but heading down the leg-side
down the track and clipped tantalisingly in the air, but inches short of Azhar at short midwicket... lucky...
down the track again, Yasir spots him coming and pulls back his length. Cat and mouse stuff...
played against the spin, a bit of a panicky release shot, in all honesty, but well nailed in front of square
forward and punched into the covers. A good recovery from England after four dot-balls in that over
down the track, swiped airily into the leg-side
on the back foot, punched square into the covers, nice open face and an easy couple, into the gap
driven into the leg side
on the back foot again, and Irfan's towering height is an easy single, even though he is nominally in position to cut it off. They have to turn on a special hazard light every time he bends down
pushed to the leg-side
on the pads again, an instant call. Good smart running from this pair
driven down the ground, another single
width, and slapped out to point
down the track, pushed to mid-on
forward and pushed to long-off
low full toss, driven hard but long-off is in place
angled bat, fended to point, a quick single is threatened but wisely turned down
on the hip, clipped to square leg
forward and driven to long-on, the score keeps ticking
half an appeal, but outside leg
clipped in the air, but short of short midwicket. Good teasing flight
on the hip, pulled round the corner and Root calls instantly as Yasir stoops to gather at backward square leg. Sharp running again
full length and fended away
forward and defended
tossed up, outside off, and flat-batted violently through cover. Beats the close catcher but is cut off in the deep
bosh! Fetch that. Down on one knee, full swing against the spin, deposited grandly over midwicket
shuffling at the crease and dabbed out of the keeper's gloves to gully
worked into the off side again
whoomphed to cover. Lots of intent but the placement was lacking
clipped off the toes to square leg
flicked to the leg-side once again
up and under! Roy feared for a moment he had got too much height and not enough velocity, like a badly launched Angry Bird, but it plopped out of the reach of long-off for a maximum!
nudged into the gap to let Root have a go
round the wicket, reverse sweep, but straight to backward point
down on one knee and flicked more conventionally this time, behind square
clipped to midwicket
Root returns the compliment
it's a four, but not as we know it. That had designs for a single through midwicket. Instead it was a leading edge through third man
a more intentional edge this time, down to third man again. Soft hands
edged and dropped! A loose poke to a gentle leg-break, and that looked to have taken a deflection off the tip of the keeper's gloves which in turn baffled Rizwan at slip
Root flicks another leg-side single, he does play it well
round the wicket, tossed onto the pads, and flicked out to square leg
another calm nurdle into the leg-side. It is his default one-day stroke
dancing at the crease, cut firmly into the gap at extra cover. Well timed and placed
forward and pushed to cover
clipped to midwicket
on the hip, worked square once more
back of a length, cut down into the crease and tidied up at slip
energetic cut, down towards the rope at deep backward point
down the track, driven but not entirely timed. Long-off picks up
driven again, no great turn on offer and eased down the ground
short, this one turns but is watched all the way onto the bat. Cover fields
up onto the toes, on the back foot, steered out to extra cover, more measured accumulation from England
clipped out to midwicket again
worked into the off-side for a change as Root opens the face and picks off a couple to third man
wristy flick, on the up, through midwicket. The 150 is up
clipped to midwicket
swept, and though that passes down the leg side, it comes so close to clipping the leg bail that it is rightly not called a wide
a lap-sweep, more or less what he attempted to play last ball, but he connects this time, a lob over the keeper's shoulder to pick off another couple
beautiful strike, a full-blooded reverse sweep, big swing of the bat, and helped through third man
cut into the covers
on the pads, flicked to midwicket
driven on the up, anchored on the back foot, well cut off on the long-off boundary by a full-tilt Azhar
forward and blocked down the pitch
on the back foot, punched into the covers
clunked into the covers
on the pads, nurdled to backward square
on the back foot, dead-batted to cover and a bit of a scamper to get up speed from a standing start
short, a mow across the line but that may be kept a bit low. No contact either way
through to the keeper
down on one knee and flambeed out to midwicket. Top boshing!
worked into the gap
crunched out to cover
down the track, full extension of the arms, a spiralling straight six, and that is Root's fifty! A beautiful shot to reach his second of the series
worked into the leg side again
reverse sweep, and *beep beep beep*, Irfan lowers his crane to field and they steal an easy single
shot! Leaning back, all timing and placement, a glide through backward point off only a nugget of width
well timed again, in a similar direction, but third man is in place to field this time
flicked off the pads, whistles to the rope behind square, he's onto 98 ...
open face, dabbed to point
open face, dabbed to gully
again, attempts to pick the gap at third man, but with three dots in a row, it is time for drinks
touch short, Root rocks back and pulls to deep midwicket
a low full toss won't do it, eased down the ground to long off
pushes forward and the ball squeezes off the inside edge to the leg side
comes forward, hint of turn, thickish outside edge to short third man
there it is! Roy has his maiden ODI hundred as he cuts a slightly short delivery out to deep cover. Comes off 113 balls. An outstanding innings, he didn't find it easy early on
pushed back to the bowler
short and cut through cover to long off
beats him with a quicker one outside off which skids on as Root tries to dab to third man
tossed up full and straight, worked down the ground
uses his feet, doesn't get to the pitch as Azhar drags his length back, pushed to cover
tucked away
full and driven to long off
short outside off, swipe to cover off the bottom of the bat
short again, he rocks back and sends this through cover to the sweeper

he's gone now! Yasir gets a scalp. So it's hundred and out for Roy. He came down the pitch, looking to go straight down the ground, he skewed it towards long off and it didn't have the legs to clear the rope
driven to deep cover
full outside off, spins away, left alone
worked into the leg side to get off the mark and keep the strike
edged away from outside off, but short third man scurries across
that's a lovely on-the-up drive over extra cover, fully in control by Root as he places it between deep cover and long off
finds point this time, a slightly quicker delivery
and he's got a wicket! Root goes for an expansive reverse sweep, doesn't make contact, then unbalances out of the crease and Sarfraz whips off the bails. Was that really needed from Root?
flicked to the leg side
an appeal for lbw as this takes the pad to the leg side, beating leg stump
dropped into the off side
round the wicket, short of a length, opens the face and slides off the face to third man
full and straight, tucked in front of square on the leg side
back of a length outside off, pushed to backward point
angling in from round the wicket, defended
defended square into the off side
taken from outside off, flicked with bottom hand to long on
full on off stump, driven to deep cover
uses his feet, gets very close to the pitch and drills it along the ground to long on
drifts into the pads, tucked behind square
some more sharp spin for Azhar, turns into Morgan's pads from around middle and leg
plays with the turn into the leg side
cut into the off side
brings out the slog sweep and makes good connection, Malik round the wicket, Buttler goes down on his back need and picks it up cleanly over deep midwicket
flatter on the pads, nudged into the leg side
dragged down a little short, Morgan is very quick to spot the length, put his weight onto the back foot and pulled over deep midwicket
turn there, Morgan aiming to the leg side and gets a leading edge to point
now Morgan slog sweeps, not quite middled as well as Buttler's, it's a flatter hit and goes one bounce to deep midwicket
down the pitch, makes it a full toss, driven to long off
and he has another! Morgan charges down the pitch, might have been the googly from Azhar, Morgan swings and misses which offers Sarfraz a second stumping
full outside off, driven to cover
low full toss which is shovelled down the ground to long on
another googly, not sure Buttler picked it, nudged back down the pitch
a googly again, but this one is too short and Buttler can pull to deep square
short of a length, angled down the leg side
back of a length outside off, he finds point
fuller, pushed square to point
pushes a length ball into a gap on the off side
on a length outside off, 77mph, a cutter, Taylor is well across his crease and dabs to backward point
terrific shot, he was so quick onto that, Irfan dropped a little short and his natural bounce made it pullable for Taylor who connects cleanly and sends it over long leg
back outside off, short of a length, backward point prevents the single
pushes forward, dribbles into the leg side...has to dive back into his ground returning for a second, good running
down the pitch, nice delivery, turns and Buttler pushes to cover
this is straight down the ground, a massive strike from Buttler, beautifully clean as he strides down the pitch and launches into the stand above the sightscreen...dropped in the crowd
full outside leg, goes to sweep and takes the pad to short third man
pushed back to the bowler
fuller, whipped to the on side, Azhar dives across to field but the ball sneaks underneath him and then steal a single
round the wicket, full on the stumps, flicked to midwicket
short of a length, takes his bottom hand off the bat and works to the leg side
moves across to the off side and picks up a back-of-a-length delivery with a front-foot pull through square leg
and now he brings out the reverse scoop, flick over short third man...Buttler at his inventive best, he was going to scoop over fine leg the saw the ball was wider and went off side. Freak.
huge appeal for lbw as he heaves across the line at a full toss, think there was an inside edge, and then there is a direct hit from backward point which ricochets away for a second run
full outside, driven through backward point, deep point runs around - it's Yasir - he dives but he can't stop the ball cleanly and it dribbles into the boundary
dropped square into the off side
moves away to the leg side, opens up the off and carves this in the air over cover wide of the sweeper...Buttler into top gear
that's a few more! A mighty blow over the leg side this time, Wahab drops short and Buttler muscles it off the front foot over deep square leg
very full and quite wide outside off, Buttler just inched to the leg side and let it go...not a wide. Back-of-the-hand slower ball
low full toss angling into the batsman who flicks down to long on and these two are so quick it's a comfortable brace
shorter delivery, on the pads, pulled down to long leg and that's a 30-ball fifty for Buttler...super innings
full outside off, swing and miss as he aims to the leg side
another rasping pull from Buttler as Anwar drops short, he doesn't have the pace for that, and it's swatted through square leg
goes full this time, Buttler jabs it into the pitch and it bounces straight down the ground...Taylor makes it into a second, again
this is reverse swept off the stumps, played it as though he has done it all his life (which he has)...wonderful stuff
dragged down short and it's another full pint into the stands at deep square leg as Buttler pulls with effortless ease. Carnage.
big full toss this time which also disappears over the leg-side boundary, not easy to dispatch a full toss like that but Buttler was able to easily clear the boundary. Close to a no-ball for height
round the wicket, now Taylor is down the pitch and drives to deep cover...feeding the strike back to Buttler
scooped over the keeper! He just keeps going. Was a short-of-a-length delivery, he moved to the off side and placed it straight back over Sarfraz...need a long stop
good full delivery, inside-edged to the leg side
full outside off, scythed off a thick outside edge high down to third man but drops short of the fielder
loses his shape a little this time as he charges down on the line of leg stump and misses his heave to leg
not quite the distance! Taylor aiming to clear long on, swinging a full delivery from Irfan down the ground, couldn't quite get the distance to go with the height
full outside off, Moeen drives over the top
slower ball outside off, Moeen works it into the leg side
low full toss outside off, steered between short third man and backward point...playing with the field
lobs into space! Got underneath a pull this time, went high into the air, but none of three fielders covering in the deep can reach it
good yorker, pinged straight down the pitch and into the non-striker's stumps
a yorker at off stump, drilled to mid-off so Moeen has the strike
a slower bouncer, swatted through midwicket
goes across his stump to scoop over fine leg again, but doesn't make contact this time
another full house for him, a half-tracked from Anwar which Buttler swings off the front foot over deep midwicket
worked through midwicket
oh, what a shot! Full on off stump and he drills it straight down the ground over long-off...onto 98

and he's done it! What an innings from Buttler! He reaches a 46-ball hundred with a huge hit over deep midwicket. Fed more length from Anwar and Buttler wasn't going to miss out. What a comeback for him.
full and driven down the ground...over to you, Jos
round the wicket, speared down the leg side, wide of a diving Sarfraz
slower ball, full outside off, Buttler swings and misses for a rare occasion
that's filthy, a massive full toss outside off, called no-ball for height
ah, that's a delightful shot...most batsmen would try to smash a free hit, but Buttler just flicked this calmly off his toes behind square on the leg side
length ball, angling into him, and he splits the gap between long on and deep midwicket with a solid club
low full toss outside off, driven to deep cover and they canter a couple
finishes full, flat-bats over deep cover, lands short of the sweeper and it's another brace to end a fantastic innings from Buttler (and England)

inn2.comm: on the pads, nudged into the leg-side
on the pads, whipped to the leg side. Almost a cut-and-paste job, but he beats the field this time
angling back into the pads again, can't work it away this time
beautiful bowling, that one just goes straight on with the arm, Shehzad was playing for the swing but it nipped the other way and beat the edge
clunked down to mid-on
swinging back into the pads, a delicate deflection and that races away fine. A welcome boundary. A few more of those needed in the next 49 overs though ...
outside off, good lift off the deck, and a flimsy wafty pokey prod at thin air
cramped for room on a leg-stump line
down the leg-side. We'll have that one again
chiselled off the toes, beautiful timing and clean through square leg
working with the left-armer's inswinging angle once again, clipped off the toes, well timed like a chip onto the green, and a long chase to field
a big wild whoosh at nothing, outside off
driven handsomely through the covers, it's a brisk start, I'll grant you that
on the toes, flicked away
back and across, cut firmly down to third man, fielded on the bounce
punched out to point
spanked into the covers, but straight at Taylor who spreads himself well to field
on the pads again, a relentless line of attack
curling back into the right-hander, slightly more off-stump line this time
curling back into the right hander
stand and deliver, thumped into the leg-side
outside off and no stroke offered this time
down the leg side, not quite nailed his line yet
forward and defended
pushed down the ground
wallop, fetch me another! A shot I play often in the nets, huge amounts of room outside leg stump, a blind swing in the general arc of the ball, and a flail over cow corner
forward and pushed down the ground
dropped! Taylor barely saw it at short cover, and he damn nearly wore that on his forehead! His fingers took the heat but that was sizzling
width outside off stump and lambasted through the covers. A painful-looking dive into the ropes as Taylor is made to put his body on the line once again
worked more calmly into the leg-side
Shehzad returns the favour
short-arm pull, out to deep midwicket
good length, angled in towards off stump, pushed to mid-on
short and aggressive, an attempted pull and Azhar misses out
whoops, couldn't pull that same stunt twice. Azhar was waiting for another short one, and it was brutally dispatched over midwicket!
outside off, twanged through point and Pakistan are making a real fist of this chase
tighter line and length, respectfully defended
good yorker to finish but the damage in that over had already been done
pulled out to square leg, not entirely timed
cut hard but half stopped at point
short and pulled straight down the throat of deep midwicket! England have persisted with a selection of short balls and this one does the trick!
swinging into the pads and that's a fine way to launch an innings. Flicked off the toes, clean through square leg
driven with a closed face to short midwicket
very wide half-volley, Hafeez reaches for the drive and denies Pakistan an extra
short, on the back foot, clipped firmly but snaffled at short midwicket, who is being kept involved
stick a rocket on that one! Not desperately short of a length, but thoroughly launched, high and mighty into the stands at midwicket
poor bowling, fired down the leg-side and deflected out of Buttler's reach behind the stumps
on the pads, dabbed square, a quick look and run
chiselled into the leg-side
tapped to square leg, a brisk single as the fielder tumbles to gather
pushed back into the crease, defended to midwicket
tailing from off to middle, firmly pushed back towards the bowler who attempts a deflection onto the non-striker's stumps
lifting across the right-hander, outside off, a controlled upper-cut edge through third man. No man for the catch so that's fair game
deary me, that is a lame way to depart! A fractionally slower ball, and a limp chip back to the bowler. Silence in the stadium
on the toes, clipped to square leg
a fat edge, definitely not a controlled one this time as there was a slip in place. But that flew through the gully and away to the rope
full and straight, pushed to mid-on
pushed back into the crease, poked to cover, a scampered single
blotted off the back foot, into space at third man
punched to cover
blocked off the back foot to cover
baseball-batted through midwicket, a fine diving pounce from Topley at wide mid-on saves the four
swinging delivery, pushed calmly to mid-off
pushed to cover
banged in short, no stroke offered
whipped off the pads, and that fizzes through the gap at backward square. Too short, too leg-sided. Swatted
pushed back into the crease, defended
banged in short, down the leg side, pretty dreadful bowling to be frank, but a tumbling stop saves Willey's bacon this time
on the back foot, fenced to short midwicket, an easy single but Hafeez's running is once again phenomenally sketchy
thump! Full face of the bat, meeting the pitch of the ball and deposited, one bounce, back over the bowler's head. Tidy
good riposte, full and fast and demanding a respectful block
outside off, worked down to third man
outside off, clobbered to cover, picked up on the bounce
on the back foot, working round the corner
crashed through the covers, no time to settle!
whipped fiercely to square leg, but more aggro than output
better length, drawing a defensive poke to mid-on
driven down the ground to long-on
worked into the leg-side again
on the pads, tapped to deep square leg
a flapped drive, through the line of Topley's left-arm offerings. A late call as the ball bobbles past the bowler's outstretched hand
poked to point
blam! Right underneath the pitch of the ball, picked up clean as a whistle over cow corner. He read the slower ball like a comic strip and battered it on one knee
too wide
outside off, and tapped out to point
down the leg side, Topley hasn't been allowed to settle today
smashed, who needs footwork when your eye is in? Slower ball, pumped down the line like a Djokovic winner
defended back to the bowler
plopped onto a spinner's length, pushed down the ground in a thoroughly standard passage of play
drawn out of the crease, bat-padded away
sharp spin from outside off, takes the pad
flicked out to midwicket
forward, drawn out of the crease, and pushed back to the bowler with a crabby defence

dropped! That's pretty terrible from Alex Hales. Right back on the rope at cow corner, perhaps it came out of the lights, but he was set and ready to swallow the chance, and it burst straight through his fingers
punched back to the bowler, who half-fields in his followthrough
walloped. Reminiscent of KP's slap at McGrath during his Oval 158. Minus the once-in-a-generation drama, of course. Topley's outstretched hand takes the pace off the ball
outside off and spanked into the covers
up and over, and drops inches short of the cover sweeper. That would have been a cheap departure
too short, too easy. Swivel-pulled through midwicket for a one-bounce four!
short outside leg stump, pulled to deep backward square
straighter delivery, worked into midwicket
full and straight, driven to the off side, Moeen comes across to field
tossed up and flicked to midwicket
sweeps this time, from around off stump, deep square does the work
lovely touch, drifting towards leg stump and he gets it just wide of the keeper to fine leg
full on off stump, driven sweetly to cover where there's a good save
finds the gap this time out to the sweeper
good placement as he drives again and places it wide of the sweeper
that's a beauty! Drift and spin from middle stump, takes it past the outside edge as he presses forward
driven back to the bowler
googly to end the over, he steps back and drives square through the off side
full and straight, dead-batted to the off side
shorter but he can't take advantage and finds cover
a bit of a cross-batted swipe this time, it's in the air but wide of square leg
some decent spin for Moeen, turns into the pads and loops onto the leg side
and again, spins into the pads, deflects to short fine leg

another run out! This time it's the Hafeez-Azam show. Driven gently into the off side, cover came across to his left (Willey to his strong side) and had plenty of time to return to Buttler with Hafeez trying to turn like the Titanic in mid-pitch
full on middle, blocked
pushed back to the bowler...chance for England to build some more pressure here
dragged down short, pulled in the air but wide of midwicket
short and wide, he just amount manages to reach it, out to deep cover
wonderful strike, inside-out over extra cover, Rashid gave it a touch more flight and that was a very classy response from Azam
quicker delivery, worked down the ground to long on
the boundaries keep coming as he puts away a low full toss square through the off side, used his wrists nicely to find the gap behind point
worked off the pads to square leg
dragged down very short, square leg does well with a dive and it's just a single
full outside off, flicked along the ground through midwicket
short and punched back to the bowler
a lovely late dab through short third man, waited for the delivery, open the face. Chased hard by Taylor
nicely bowled, this gripped, turned from leg stump and took the pad
aims to play this to the leg side but doesn't make contact
this one slides down the leg side
full outside off, a strong drive through the covers and the sweeper can't stop the second
tighter to the stumps, straight on delivery, opens the face to the covers
flicks a shorter delivery into the leg side but can't beat Moeen at square leg
full outside off, can't get the placement as he drives hard into the pitch and finds cover
that's massive! Into the second tier over deep midwicket. He came down the pitch and connected sweetly as he swung in a clean arc over the leg side
and now he tickles this fine off his pads, deep square gets around
that's a friendly full toss but only costs a single as he drives to long on
goes back to force through the off side but doesn't make contact
tucked off the stumps behind square on the leg side
gets across onto off stump, flicks through square leg and this time there's good judgement on the running as Malik was quickly calling for the second
full on leg stump, defended
down the pitch, drives firmly but comes from near the bottom of the bat
swept off the stumps to backward square leg
full and straight, dug out down the ground to long on
goes back in the crease and flips this down to long on
that's HUGE! Top tier this time. Straight down the ground. Swift footwork once again and Rashid gets some more neckache as he watches this disappear over long on
tucked off the pads behind square on the leg side, more good running...Azam onto 49
full outside off, beats the edge as Azam drives
full again, dug out through the covers to take him to a fifty off 49 balls
short of a length at off stump, aims to the leg side but gets a leading edge to cover
short and he's quickly onto it with a pull which is just wide of deep square
full outside off, punches through the line to deep cover

Hales holds on this time! Azam aiming to clear deep cover, gets too far underneath the ball and can't get the distance on his shot. Hales comes in from deep cover - he has to be aware of two other fielders close by - and holds a good catch as he slides on his knees. He's pumped with that.
short outside leg stump, flicked through the leg side
fantastic way to get off the mark, sweeps from outside off and sends it rocketing square of the wicket...Pakistan are just going to keep going by the looks of it
forced off the back foot into the leg side
pushed down the leg side, good take from Buttler
full and driven to cover
full and driven to cover
opens the face and dabs to third man
driven on the up square of the wicket
full outside off, 73mph, driven to the sweeper
short on off stump, been a profitable ball for Woakes this series, pulled to midwicket
another short one, again he finds midwicket with the pull
makes up for those dot balls with a very effective heave over the leg side, Woakes went to length and Malik flogged it over wide mid-on
into the stands again! Lovely footwork from Rizwan as he comes down the pitch and merely flicks Rashid over long on
what a response from Rashid! Brings out a well-pitched leg-break which grips and grazes Rizwan's edge as he plays forward, pushing away from his pad a little. Excellent from Rashid
full on the stumps, pushed to mid-on...they wisely decline a single
picks out cover with the drive
cuts a shorter delivery to backward point where Taylor can't stop it cleanly
the front-of-the-hand delivery from Rashid, skids on, Malik cuts and it comes off the top edge fine of short third man
short outside off, cut to point...and Sarfraz's bat has come apart! The handle has snapped off. That will make a super picture
new bat in hand he drives square through the off side...Topley had come round the wicket
angled in from round the wicket, he opens the face and guides to third man
short ball, he doesn't get hold of it, pulls to the right of mid-on and Sarfraz has to get a dive out to make his ground...actually would have been well out with a direct hit
neatly cut wide of third man, Rashid does very well to keep it inside the boundary as he flicks it back
uses his feet, it's a full delivery, Malik drives and gets a thick inside edge to fine leg
was that a catch? Absolutely hammered back at Rashid. Ah, no, it fell well short. Was a good stop
works a quicker ball to midwicket
can't beat mid-on as he drives
down the track, another quicker, flatter delivery, and he gets hoicked through midwicket...this is helter-skelter stuff
on the stumps, can't beat cover on the drive
in the air this time but wide of cover inside the circle and the sweeper keeps it to a single
driven to point, Roy throws at the stumps and hits...then gives away a wasteful single. Not the first time he has done that. Batsman was always in
full at the toss, flicked out to deep square leg who can't stop the second
on off stump, guided to third man
shorter delivery, angled into the body, pulled to deep square
low full toss, driven to cover
tucked off the pads in front of square so he keeps the strike
he keeps finding the boundary, a mow across the line but shrewdly placed by Malik as he splits the deep field
fuller and flatter, nudged to the leg side and there's another overthrow as the backing up can't stop the shy from midwicket
full and straight, eased down the ground to take him to an excellent fifty off just 30 balls
on the stumps, dabbed square into the off side
flat-batted square through the off side
comes down the pitch, didn't get to the ball so he smartly just pads the ball away
full from round the wicket, driven to deep cover

what a catch! Hales is making up for that earlier drop. He has taken a blinder here. Malik swinging a full delivery into the leg side, didn't get a great connection but Hales had a lot of ground to make from deep square. Managed to do so, and took the catch low to the ground
blatted into the covers, finds the gap
round the wicket, angled into the pads, worked to leg
driven on the up, into the covers
on the back foot, nudged to gully
dropped! Though to be fair it hardly counts, Morgan did well even to reach it at short midwicket, tipped around the post, goalkeeper style
front of the hand delivery, skidding on
worked off the pads to short square leg
swept, supremely, clean through the gap, all along the ground
slogged into no-man's land at deep cover
swept again, but straight to the fielder
front foot planted, a firm sweep. Fine leg tidies up
driven with a full face to wide long-on
flicked off the toes, but straight to midwicket
shorter and flatter, helped into space on the leg side
defended on the back foot to mid-on
swept again, a tidy over from Moeen, just the five runs from it
tonked. Three strides and a wallop. That'll do
three strides and a wallop ... straight to mid-on! He scuffed this one, and Willey clung onto a stinger!
on the pads, tapped square
spanked into the gap at cow corner. Pakistan haven't abandoned all hope yet
down the track, clears the man at mid-on, that bounds into the boundary boards, and Pakistan's requirement dips below 100
googly, I think (not sure I can pick it yet...) but swept regardless
down the leg side
tossed up, driven, into the bread-basket, it's nearly over now ...
whipped off the legs, sharp running and a big dive, and they get back for two
odd noises there, sounded like an edged drive, or was it the toe-end scuffing the turf? I think the latter.
driven into the covers
onto the back foot, defended out to point
spank-a-doodle-doo. Down the track, whistled over midwicket. He hits a long ball
swished across the line to deep midwicket
defended into the leg side
driven on the up to midwicket
on the pads, a gentle clip out to the leg-side. There is a serenity so far about this partnership, as if they have twigged that it is less than a run a ball ...

having said that, there is a horrid static hoick from deep in the crease, and David Willey running in from deep long-on can't quite get his fingers under the ball. Or maybe he does, as he is in a significant amount of pain. That could smart ...
a play and a miss to complete the over
clattered down the ground, lots of intent but the field is set back
half an appeal as Yasir misses a slog sweep
battered into the deep, and that is easy pickings for Woakes at wide long-on. Nearly done
driven back to the bowler
down the track, tapped to midwicket
defended
on the back foot, and angled into the covers
forward and defended into the covers
bouncer! Grrr ... did well to get it that high, to be fair. Irfan turns his head and wears it on the armpit
outside off, a loose poke
punched down the track
tossed onto a good length, fielded inadvertently by the non-striker, Irfan
tonked out to wide long-on

tossed up, driven, plucked low at short cover, and England have sealed the series! Or have they? A quick check upstairs to make sure it carried, but the fielders are in little doubt. A pretty futile faff, the umpire's soft signal was out, and sure enough, it is!
